image.altText: The front entrance of a hospital with a red-tiled roof and a driving bay and two flag poles out front.

props.synopsis: A locum doctor who walked out of a contract at Port Pirie Hospital after 45 minutes because it was "so understaffed that it was dangerous" has lost an appeal over her conduct. Dr Amira Mahboub saw just one patient before she left and failed to alert the appropriate managers she would not finish the contract.

title.children: Locum doctor left SA hospital, saying working there was 'too dangerous'

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Brock Yandle, the brother of accused murderer Keith Yandle, told police he heard screaming and gunshots on the night Steven Murphy was killed in a shed at Kudla, a jury has heard.

title.children: 'He kept screaming': Jury told accused murderer's brother heard shooting

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas wearing a navy suit sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government first held talks with insolvency firm KordaMentha about placing the Whyalla steelworks into administration on December 23, new documents reveal.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks administration talks began before Christmas

image.altText: Crime scene tape outside a home.

props.synopsis: South Australia's youth justice system was 'flooded' with almost 6,000 new cases last year, data obtained by the state's opposition shows, while the state's top cop is frustrated at the level of resourcing needed to tackle repeat young offenders.

title.children: Youth justice system 'flooded' in SA as top cop expresses frustration at repeat offenders

image.altText: A teenaged girl wearing a broad brimmed hat smiling and standing in front of a group of sheep.

props.synopsis: When the 19-year-old's phone fell from her ute tray while she was checking water troughs in far west New South Wales, it triggered a region-wide emergency response.

title.children: Smartphone mishap triggers big outback crash 'emergency'

image.altText: Image of a woman smiling holding a hat

props.synopsis: A determined group of Kangaroo Island farmers have turned an unlikely dream into reality by opening a local wool mill in the wake of the Black Summer bushfires.

title.children: Disaster inspires a new future for Kangaroo Island's wool growers

image.altText: A profile photo of a man with apparent face art.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering his cellmate in an Adelaide prison has been declared mentally incompetent to commit the crime and found not guilty.

title.children: Man accused of cellmate murder found not guilty by reason of mental incompetence

image.altText: Musician Lou Bennett on stage performing with the Australian String Quartet. She has eyes closed and wears Cultural make-up

props.synopsis: In the latest What Sparks Art interview, musical powerhouse Lou Bennett speaks to ABC Arts about her incredible career so far, her upcoming Adelaide Festival show, and the sources of inspiration she finds in 'histories colliding and clashing'.

title.children: Music legend Lou Bennett's early songs were driven by pain. Then something shifted

image.altText: A fawn dingo looks on from behind a mesh fence in bushland

props.synopsis: Farmers are concerned after a bushfire revealed a dingo breeding site has been operating in Victoria's Little Desert National Park, but a conservationist says it poses no threat to livestock.

title.children: Farmers call for public meeting amid dingo breeding site discovery

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young man cleaning a gun, cigarette in mouth

props.synopsis: More than 50 years ago, five young men from a small farming community fought in the Vietnam War. Now their stories have been written so people will know them more than "just a name on a plaque".

title.children: Vietnam vet has never worn his medals but his story is immortalised

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt stands in front of a red and white truck.

props.synopsis: Footage showing a series of near misses between cars and trucks on a regional South Australian highway is being circulated online, prompting calls for drivers to take more care.

title.children: Dash cams capture drivers' close calls with trucks on SA highway

image.altText: SA driver captured by mobile detection camera appeared to show them holding a burger and a mobile phone

props.synopsis: SA Police have released more images captured by mobile detection cameras showing drivers using phones, not having any hands on the wheel and not observing due care while driving.

title.children: Warning to distracted drivers after 17 lives lost on SA roads this year

image.altText: Buildings at a steelworks.

props.synopsis: Whyalla's steelworks has gone into administration for the second time in under a decade. Here is a look at how events have unfolded in the city in recent years.

title.children: Administrators, shutdowns and hope: A quick history of Whyalla's steelworks

image.altText: Beaumont children photographed at the Twelve Apostles.

props.synopsis: A private team is embarking on a fresh dig for answers to one of Australia's most enduring mysteries — the disappearance of three young children in suburban Adelaide on Australia Day in 1966.

title.children: Hopes private search will test Beaumont theory 'once and for all'

image.altText: Honoree Jane Fonda accepts the SAG Life Achievement Award onstage during the 31st Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards

props.synopsis: The 87-year-old actor and activist made the most of her time on stage while accepting the SAG Life Achievement Award.

title.children: 'I'm not done': Jane Fonda lights up SAG awards with fiery speech

image.altText: Two men speaking

props.synopsis: Donald Trump continues to push Ukraine to provide the US with minerals to repay Washington for wartime aid. Here's what minerals Ukraine has and why the US wants a share.

title.children: Trump is demanding half of Ukraine's rare earth minerals and China may be why

image.altText: A brightly coloured map showing the progress of a cyclone that has formed off the north-east coast of Australia.

props.synopsis: The storm is expected to continue to gain strength as it slowly moves over the Coral Sea.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Alfred intensifies into category two system

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in a Tasmanian court via phone to face allegations he stole a car in the Huon Valley, south of Hobart.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann faces Hobart court on car theft charge

image.altText: The logo of crypto exchange platform Bybit with bitcoins around it

props.synopsis: The Dubai-based platform Bybit said an attacker gained control of an Ethereum wallet and transferred its holdings to an unknown address.

title.children: Hackers steal $2.4bn from crypto exchange Bybit in 'largest heist' of all time

image.altText: A woman standing behind a microphone pointing with one finger up.

props.synopsis: For the first time since World War II, a far-right party has come second in a German national election.

title.children: What the German far right's biggest win since before WWII means

image.altText: A tightly cropped image of Canberra Raiders teammates Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies in the midst of a try celebration.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders players Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies will front the media over an incident in their hotel in Las Vegas ahead of the NRL season opener.

title.children: NRL stars involved in Las Vegas hotel incident days before season opener

image.altText: A woman is approached by an airport worker as she walks through the security area of the airport.

props.synopsis: A magistrate describes a woman's behaviour as "extremely bizarre" as he sentences her for evading security staff and running out onto the tarmac at Canberra Airport in 2023.

title.children: 'Extremely bizarre': Woman fined for running onto Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: A man in a hat and glasses standing by a door in an apartment

props.synopsis: A fourth climate protester who staged a "publicity stunt" at the home of Woodside's CEO Meg O'Neill in the presence of an ABC film crew is fined in court.

title.children: Fourth climate activist sentenced over protest at Woodside CEO's Perth home

image.altText: Men playing cricket on a video live feed in Traralgon

props.synopsis: Wild scenes of a brawl during a regional cricket match in Victoria's east have been broadcast online.

title.children: Headbutt, punches as live-streamed local cricket match erupts

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A NSW Marine Rescue boat on the water.

props.synopsis: Marine police say a missing fisherman reeled in a mako shark and then lost his footing before being dragged under water 55 kilometres off the NSW coast.

title.children: Missing Sydney fisherman pulled overboard by mako shark

image.altText: A close up of a woman's hands holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Millions of dollars have been stolen from members of Victoria's Chinese-speaking community through a sophisticated extortion scam which police are warning is on the rise.

title.children: A fake Chinese authority scam is extorting millions from victims

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: A teenage girl has told the WA Supreme Court how three men with metal poles chased Cassius Turvey and others in suburban Perth, accusing them of smashing windows.

title.children: Teen recalls moment she saw Cassius Turvey after alleged attack

image.altText: A police car with its lights on.

props.synopsis: There were a string of violent home invasions and armed robberies across Victoria's south-eastern suburbs over the weekend, police say.

title.children: Police lay charges after 77yo woman allegedly struck with machete

image.altText: A military service Belgian shepherd sits on the grass in front of the Australian War Memorial.

props.synopsis: A Belgian shepherd who went from pound puppy to decorated combat veteran has been honoured with a new award for distinguished military service at the Australian War Memorial.

title.children: 'The $8 dog' wins prestigious award for military service

image.altText: Two peacocks stand on a residential driveway, one has its feathers out.

props.synopsis: The NSW EPA has found that a group of peacocks found dead in Ourimbah died after ingesting pesticides with community groups calling for tougher restrictions around handling the chemicals.

title.children: Pesticides blamed for 'devastating' deaths of popular peacocks

image.altText: A sign that says "Manunda".

props.synopsis: Two 15-year-olds and a 16-year-old accused of sexually assaulting a woman at knifepoint in Cairns last week have been remanded in custody.

title.children: Teens accused of home invasion rape ordered to undergo disease testing

image.altText: Broken glass at the entrance of a liquor store

props.synopsis: Merome Beard was posting campaign signs in Carnarvon when her car was stolen. Police say it was later used to rob a liquor store.

title.children: WA Liberal MP's car stolen and used to ram-raid liquor store

image.altText: A computer-generated image off a rocket blasting off in a country area.

props.synopsis: The Queensland company planning to send satellites to space from Australia says its first test rocket could launch anytime from March 15.

title.children: First Australian-made space rocket set to blast off in matter of weeks
